items.sentence: I don't like what Tom did any more than you do.
Tom is carrying a duffel bag over his shoulder.
I have to let Tom know when the meeting starts.
Tom doesn't think Mary will be at school today.
It's a good thing you didn't go to Tom's party.
Do you think Tom knows what we were doing here?
Tom looked under the bed to see what was there.
Tom might be able to loan us the money we need.
Perhaps we should tell Tom about what happened.
Tom might be able to tell us what must be done.
I want to be ready to leave when Tom gets here.
Tom might be harder to deal with in the future.
I want to know why you and Tom don't get along.
Tom has always been a fun guy to hang out with.
Remind me to thank Tom the next time I see him.
I've been thinking about your problem with Tom.
Tom wants to know what Mary is doing in Boston.
You look just like Tom looked thirty years ago.
The car wasn't parked where Tom told me it was.
Tom never seems to pay much attention in class.
